column1: Master of Public Health (Sexual & Reproductive Health)
column5: 3 good reasons to studyThe programme prepares students for leadership roles in improving sexual, reproductive, maternal, adolescent health (SRMNAH) in a range of settings, with a focus on population health in low-and middle-income countries. The programme provides opportunities for experiential learning and application of evidence-based principles at policy and health system levels.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
